title: Works but buggy and no persistent configuration options
text:
There are so many bugs and user interface issues, it‚Äôs really an amateur app.

If your goal is to set a pair of speakers permanently or semi-permanently into a stereo configuration then expect to be disappointed: the speakers don‚Äôt stay in the last configuration through power cycles. 

Even more frustrating the app doesn‚Äôt remember the state of the speakers: for example, the speakers will be in stereo mode from the last time they were set, but the app will force you to reconnect and reset the speakers to work with them again. 

The Charge 4 speakers, only one should be paired to your device. Nothing works if both are paired and connectedüôÅ. 

The app often thinks another copy of the app is running on a different device, even when no other devices are present. 

Unnecessary requests for confirmation from the app, are tedious, the infamous ‚Äògot it‚Äô button. The app does have difficulty connecting many times when trying to use a speaker not paired as a stereo speaker or party speaker. It will tell you to bring the device closer to the speaker when it is literally less than 2 inches away. I am not sure why the connectivity issues are so ubiquitous. I am sure that there is more that can be done within the Bluetooth protocol API to make use of these friendlier. The user interface of the app is really atrocious. It would be nice for the app to honor dark mode option of iOS. But there is so much more wrong than that I hardly know where to start.  It would be great if they would add a feature that would allow you to use a previous configuration with one tap on the button, and to try over and over again behind the scenes to set things up that way, letting you know it‚Äôs trying, rather than forcing the user to try over and over and over again until it finally works, which it will, but it takes a frustrating amount of time frequently. This should be done by the processor not the user. When the music is paused, no matter how briefly, the speaker controlled by the app (not paired) to be in stereo mode will not play music for 10 to 15 seconds. You will get only one channel being played until it sort of wakes up again and realizes it should be acting as the left/ right channel. It would be great to have a persistent configuration option. So that when the speakers are both turned on they automatically go to a stereo configuration, in my case I would ask for the blue speaker to always be the right channel and the teal speaker to always be the left channel and not to have to mess with it every single time I turn them on.  The application really needs to have some semblance of state and to try to work out the connectivity issues on its own before bothering the user. That it assumes another app is involved when there is no such thing happening it‚Äôs quite frustrating.
